You meet an <vocabulary>artisan</vocabulary> and they're tacking pictures on a wall to sell. You want the artisan to make a picture of you too so you yell, "<reading>TACK ME</reading> (たくみ)!"

meanings.meaning: Bitter Enemies In The Same Boat

reading_mnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You haven't learned this reading for 舟 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

What are <vocabulary>bitter enemies in the same boat</vocabulary> supposed to do? They <reading>shoo</reading>t (しゅう) each other!

This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You already know both readings, but make sure to read 相 as しょう. This should be easy to remember since <reading>Sho</reading>guns (しょう) were like prime ministers back in the day!

Snap all the <vocabulary>bowstring</vocabulary>s! Now none of the musicians can play their instruments. "You're <reading>too ru</reading>de (つる)!" they yell, as they cry over the snapped bowstrings. They aren't wrong, that was just too rude of you.

The reading for this word is an exception. Here's a mnemonic to help you remember it: If you're feeling sluggish just turn on Darude's (だる) "Sandstorm" and it will perk you right up. But a world where people don't know Darude's "Sandstorm" is full of sluggish, dull nerds.
